item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Against /tmp (39 points | 11 comments)
2. Ghostty 1.0 is Coming (50 points | 23 comments)
3. An experiment in fighting spam on public forms using “proof of work” (11 points | 14 comments)
4. devenv is switching Nix implementation to Tvix (14 points | 5 comments)
5. Announcing Determinate Nix (11 points | 3 comments)
6. MQTT turns 25 – here’s how it has endured (10 points | 2 comments)
7. Use data that looks like data (14 points | 3 comments)
8. How to secure your new VPS: a step-by-step guide (23 points | 26 comments)
9. Debug Go core dumps with delve: export byte slices (4 points | no comments)
10. 20 years of Linux on the Desktop (part 1) (52 points | 69 comments)
11. (2^136279841)-1 is the New Largest Known Prime Number (46 points | 5 comments)
12. Jujutsu in practice (44 points | 18 comments)
13. Microsoft maintains its own Windows debloat scripts on GitHub (24 points | 4 comments)
14. An opinionated beginner's guide to Haskell in mid-2019 (2019) (9 points | 2 comments)
15. Wired’s Attack on (“Privacy”|[SimpleX Chat]) (10 points | 5 comments)
16. Modular Borrowing Without Ownership or Linear Types (5 points | 1 comment)
17. Naming Conventions That Need to Die (2018) (55 points | 72 comments)
18. Everything I built with Claude Artifacts this week (21 points | 4 comments)
19. Taming the buck with a Type III compensator (3 points | no comments)
20. Representing Knowledge and Querying Data using Double-Functorial Semantics (2 points | no comments)
21. MIME types and atom bombs (1 points | no comments)
22. Multiset Rewriting Recipe Book (2 points | no comments)
23. ‘Reflections on Trusting Trust’, but completely by accident this time (2 points | no comments)
24. UK CMA Issues statement for investigation into Apple on Mobile browsers and cloud gaming market (2 points | 1 comment)
25. The Crime Messenger: How Sky ECC Phones Became a Tool of the Criminal Trade (2 points | no comments)
